CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The lower bandgap with the broaden absorption band significantly improves a J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , which is among the highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives , while the low HOMO energy level maintains the high V OC value.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT derivatives |
| PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |
| J SC |
| Lower bandgap |
| Broadened absorption band |
| HOMO energy level |
| V OC value |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT derivatives |
| PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |

The lower bandgap and broadened absorption band are not material names, but rather properties of the materials mentioned. Therefore, they should not be included in the table.

The other entities, "J SC" and "HOMO energy level," are material properties that can be associated with the materials mentioned in the paragraph, so they are valid entities to include in the table. However, it's important to note that "J SC" is a specific material property related to the performance of the solar cells, and "HOMO energy level" is a property of the materials used in the solar cells. So, it might be more accurate to label the table as follows:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PCDTBT derivatives |
| PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |
| J SC (specific to the PSCs) |
| HOMO energy level (of the materials) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The lower bandgap with the broaden absorption band significantly improves a J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , which is among the highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives , while the low HOMO energy level maintains the high V OC value.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| lower bandgap |
| broadened absorption band |
| J SC |
| 11.7 mA / cm^2 |
| highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |
| HOMO energy level |
| high V OC value. |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| lower bandgap |
| broadened absorption band |
| J SC (11.7 mA / cm^2) |
| highest J SC values |
| HOMO energy level |
| high V OC value. |

Note: "J SC" stands for "Junction Short Circuit" current density, which is a material property. "PCDTBT derivatives" refers to a specific type of material, so it can be considered a material property as well.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The lower bandgap with the broaden absorption band significantly improves a J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 , which is among the highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives , while the low HOMO energy level maintains the high V OC value.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| lower bandgap |
| broadened absorption band |
| J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 |
| highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |
| low HOMO energy level |
| high V OC value |

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Value of material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| J SC of 11.7 mA / cm^2 |
| highest J SC values for PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives |
| low HOMO energy level |
| high V OC value |

The other entities in the paragraph do not clearly refer to material property values. "Lower bandgap with broadened absorption band" is a description of a property, not the value of the property itself. "A J SC" is an abbreviation for "current density-voltage (J-V) scan" which is a measurement method, not a property value. "Which is among the highest" is a comparative statement, not a property value. "For PSCs based on PCDTBT derivatives" is a qualifier, not a property value.
